job_tasks.justification: This phrase directly translates to 'designing, developing, and maintaining', which are core software engineering tasks related to building and managing systems.
This refers to the engineering of cloud infrastructure and platforms, which is a key component of MLOps and deploying AI systems.
Explicit mention of MLOps, a core category for managing the lifecycle of ML models in production.
DevOps practices and version control are fundamental to modern software engineering and MLOps.
Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) using tools like Docker and Kubernetes is a key aspect of MLOps and software deployment.
Deep Learning is a specialization within AI/ML model development.
Computer Vision is a specialization within AI/ML model development.
These are all standard data engineering and preparation tasks essential for AI/ML model development.

soft_skills.phrase: wil je je graag verder ontwikkelen
Fast Track van zes weken uit te groeien tot een expert
Na een succesvolle afronding heb jij als AI Engineer de kennis en kunde

profile.rationale: The job ad describes a 'Fast Track' program to become an AI Engineer, covering both core software engineering tasks (designing, developing, maintaining AI systems, cloud/platform engineering, DevOps, CI/CD) and AI specializations. While it lists 'Generative AI (LLM)' as a specialization, it also includes 'Deep Learning' and 'Computer Vision'. The emphasis on MLOps, DevOps, and general system development leans towards a balanced role. Given the explicit mention of Generative AI alongside other AI specializations and the strong software engineering foundation, 'Core GenAI Engineer' is the most fitting profile, assuming the program will provide the necessary GenAI focus.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad clearly outlines a training program leading to an AI Engineer role, detailing many relevant technical skills and areas of specialization. However, it is a description of a training program rather than a direct job posting, and the specific day-to-day tasks after the training are only broadly described. The mention of multiple AI specializations (Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Generative AI) makes it slightly less focused than a typical experienced hire role, but the overall intent is clear.
